_exec_summary.SummaryText:
WinField United - Hastings, NE



We are committed to employee, public and environmental safety.  This commitment is demonstrated by continually improving both practices and measures to prevent the release of regulated substances.  In the event of a release, the Hastings facility is prepared to work with the Adams County LEPC and/or other authorities to mitigate any release and minimize the impact to people and the environment.



The Hastings facility's primary covered process activity is the storage of fertilizers.  This activity includes processing of anhydrous ammonia by Blick's Phosphate Conversions, LLC.  Anhydrous ammonia is received and processed into 10-34-0 non-hazardous liquid fertilizer. Processing is periodic and usually occurs in the Spring and Fall.  Ammonia mixing with phosphoric acid occurs in a T-Reactor owned and operated by Blick's Phosphate Conversions, LLC.  Water is used as both a reaction feed material and product stabilizer.  The emergency procedures for Hastings are coordinated with the Adams County LEPC.



WinField United - Hastings, NE has taken the necessary steps to comply with accidental release prevention requirements set forth in 40 CFR Part 68.  This process conducted at our Hastings location is done entirely by Blick's Phosphate Conversions, LLC; and their process is also covered by OSHA's Process Safety Management standard.  The following briefly describes the prevention program elements in place at this location using Blick's Phosphate Conversions, LLC mobile T-Reactor equipment:



Process Safety Information: Blick's Phosphate Conversions, LLC maintains information describing the chemical hazards, operating parameters and equipment designs associated with the covered process.



Process Hazard Analysis: Studies are conducted to ensure the hazards associated with process operations are identified, understood and controlled.



Operating Procedures: Blick's Phosphate Conversions, LLC; written operating procedures are maintained f

or covered process operations.  Blick's Phosphate Conversions, LLC procedures address the following activities: initial startup, normal, temporary, emergency shutdown, normal shutdown and startup following a turnaround for their T-Reactor.  WinField United addresses these same items for the storage of Anhydrous Ammonia.



Hot Work Permits: In order to assure adequate controls are in place when ignition from flammable or combustible materials, the Hot Work Permit System will be utilized.  Hot work involves any welding, soldering, cutting, grinding, drilling, or any type of work where sparks may occur during operation.  These permits will be utilized where Blick's Phosphate Conversions, LLC supervisor deems them necessary for job safety. It will be the supervisor's responsibility to ensure the proper procedures are followed and keep the appropriate records.  WinField United addresses these same items for the storage of Anhydrous Ammonia.



Training: A program is in place to ensure employees of WinField United are knowledgeable and trained in procedures associated with the covered processes. Blick's Phosphate Conversions, LLC employee training records are available from Blick's Phosphate Conversions, LLC.

Mechanical Integrity: Blick's Phosphate Conversions, LLC covered process equipment is maintained consistent with generally accepted engineering practices.  Covered process equipment is routinely inspected and tested.  Maintenance activities are conducted by qualified personnel. Deficiencies are corrected in a timely manner.



Management of Change: Written procedures are in place to manage changes in process chemicals, technology, equipment and/or procedures.  Affected personnel are informed and trained to deal with authorized system changes.



Pre-Startup Review: Technical and operational reviews will be conducted on new processes and/or modifications to existing covered processes.  Reviews confirm that the construction, equipment, operating and maintenance proce

dures are suitable. Reviews are completed prior to placing equipment in operation.



Compliance Audits: Blick's Phosphate Conversions, LLC & WinField United each conduct internal audits based on each company's responsibly of working with Anhydrous Ammonia on a regular basis to determine whether the provisions specified under the RMP rule are being implemented.  At a minimum, these audits are conducted every three (3) years. Any determined corrective actions are completed in a timely manner.



Incident Investigations: If an Incident were to occur, investigations would be conducted to determine the cause of covered process incidents.  In addition to determination and correction, investigations are directed toward preventing a reoccurrence. Investigations become process safety information and are retained for five (5) years.  WinField United EHS Group may provide additional incident investigation support to Blick's Phosphate Conversions, LLC if incident should occur at the Hastings site during the T-reacting process.



Employee Participation: Blick's Phosphate Conversions, LLC & WinField United employee(s) are contributing in the following: process hazard assessments, operating procedure development, maintenance procedure development, training development and implementation, pre-startup reviews, incident investigations, and compliance audits, based on each company's employee(s) responsibility of working with Anhydrous Ammonia.  Additionally, employee(s) have access to all information pertaining to the facility's RMP.



Contractors: Periodically, contractors maybe hired to conduct specialized operational, maintenance and construction activities.  Prior to work, contractors are trained on the covered processes: relevant process safety information and emergency response actions.



Five (5) Year Accident History: There have been no accidental releases of anhydrous ammonia in the past five (5) years that have resulted in deaths, injuries or significant property damage.

Nor to our knowledge, has there been any releases resulting in off-site deaths, injuries, evacuations, property damage and/or environmental damage.



Emergency Action Plan: WinField United - Hastings, NE. Has a written emergency action plan.  This plan includes notification of the Adams County LEPC. Local authorities have been provided with emergency planning and community right-to-know information.  Blick's Phosphate Conversions, LLC also has their own Emergency Action Plan.



Planned changes to improve safety: WinField United views safety improvement as a continual process.  Periodic evaluations (both internal and external) are performed to assess the facility status.  At this time, and aside from sustaining maintenance activities, there are no additional specific safety recommendations regarding the storage of anhydrous ammonia.
